item.description:
Kiya has gratiously offered to lead a winter walk/snowshoe (depending on snow conditions) to identify some plants and trees in winter!

Kiya says:
"People should bring snowshoes, poles if they also want upper body exercise, or wear boots and stay on trail. We can do tree and shrub identification, and if there is new snow, look at tracks. Dress for the weather. There are no toilets or indoor facilities."

Please plan to arrive no later than 2pm for a 2:05 or 2:10 start....

Event will last about 1.5 to 2h depending on how it's going. If it's raining that day, check this site by 10am for updates or postponements.

We may offer this again on March 1st.

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Winter Walk/Snowshoe & Plant/Tree Identification
